author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Co-optex Thanjavur Region has set a sales target of Rs. 4.31 crore. Collector N. Subbaiyan launched the scheme at the Co-optex Vairam showroom here on Saturday. He said purchases from Co-optex ensured the customers a clean and profitable buy while helping the weavers in many traditional centres.

Speaking on the new trends and varieties being introduced constantly by the Co-optex, he said during the special sale niche products from Coimbatore, Madurai and Salem regions that had been weaved with intricate designs coloured in natural dyes would be available.

Attractive Negamam saris and Koorainadu saris of the Mayiladuthurai region have been big hits with the customers along with the new Jayakarthika saris. Hundred per cent cotton shirts and 100 per cent silk shirts had been sought after by many customers for their quality and price, he said.

Under the buy two get one free scheme, goods estimated at Rs. 2.51 crore were sold in Thanjavur Region last year and Co-optex was aiming to sell goods worth Rs. 4.31 crore. In Thanjavur district, Co-optex sold goods worth Rs. 85.23 lakh goods last year and the target was to sell Rs. 1.11 crore, according to the Co-optex Regional Manager M. Shanmugasundaram.

R. Srinivasan, Co-optex Manager, Design and production; and R. Santhanakrishnan, Manager, Vairam Showroom, were present.
title: Co-optex fixes Rs. 4.31-cr. sales target
